text: Polom () is a village in the municipality of Bratunac, Bosnia and Herzegovina.Official results from the book: Ethnic composition of Bosnia- Herzegovina population, by municipalities and settlements, 1991. census, Zavod za statistiku Bosne i Hercegovine - Bilten no.234, Sarajevo 1991. In Polom 1991 lived 436 inhabitants, of which 432 (99,08%) Serbs. In 2013, it had a population of 222 inhabitants. ==References== Category:Villages in Republika Srpska Category:Populated places in Bratunac
title: Polom (Bratunac)
